intro: Eumachia, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce small, showy flowers in shades of yellow or white. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Eumachia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
